title: Understanding and Practicing Literacy Education Policy Through Participatory Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Core Literacy Education Concepts and Basic Social Policy Understanding
context.additional_context: Learners autonomously study module-based content on an online platform using digital devices, analyze case studies from local literacy education sites, and focus on power structures in policy design and stakeholder engagement strategies.

learning_goals: Explain participatory decision-making approaches that consider social class, gender, and regional differences when designing literacy education policies.
Apply learner life-task-centered instructional design principles to draft region-specific literacy programs.
Analyze power conflict cases in policy planning and evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of decentralized decision-making models.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
